So for shits 'n giggles, I took a tour of a local tech college with its own radio broadcasting studios. I expressed my experiences and interest in their program, and holy shit. I have never had so much smoke blown up my ass in such a short period of time!
It was actually physically uncomfortable listening to them.
I‚Äôve been watching Bob, Mark, Wade, and Ethan play Settlers of Catan and I‚Äôve got very little idea what‚Äôs going on
And Ethan‚Äôs only making that worse
Robot, way. Do they just not know anything?
Does it sound like I‚Äôve played Catan
:cDo you always answer a question with another

And, Ord. It was just a whole lotta sales-pitching and bullshitting. "We could get someone like you a job in the industry in your first month, employers love our program, they have bidding wars for our students!"
The guys says while their studio proper is a mess of tangled cables and someone is trying to pluck out aa Gorillaz bassline for the umpteenth time with their amp turned up to 11.
Their radio program seemed more or less on the up and up if only a little outdated. But their recording studio program looked like a joke.

It was a little concerning though when I talked with one of their second year students and they could't identify the microphone they were using in the radio booth. Firstly it is a very iconic microphone for the recording industry...
And secondly, and secondly it has its name written right on the darn thing.
